fields.summary: Add searching or filtering to Manage Groups screen

fields.description:
All the groups from one repository are listed, then all the groups from the other. This is due to the way that the MergedPager operates. 

Really they should be interleaved as necessary to appear in alphabetical order, or something similar. If this isn't possible (perhaps due to LDAP limitations), close this issue as "Won't Fix".
fields.summary: Manage Groups lists groups from LDAP and Confluence in a meaningless way

fields.description: I'm not sure whether this is even possible but we should investigate it. If it isn't, close this issue as "Won't Fix".
fields.summary: Sort LDAP groups and users alphabetically on administrative pages

fields.description:
AtlassianUser did not correctly escape LDAP special characters (including commas, ampersands, and probably more) in distinguished names (DNs) or filters.

This was fixed in Confluence 2.2.3.
fields.summary: LDAP queries do not escape special characters correctly

fields.description:
Create a Mac version!
- Jonathan

assign to: Brendan Patterson
fields.summary: a Mac installer version!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-6556].
  {panel}

Whilst the uninstaller removes all the icons in the startup menu, it does not seem to remove any actual files in the file system.

Chai suggested that you might want to get in touch with the Install4J folks if you do get stuck - they have proved to be really helpful in the past.
- Ernest

assign to: Brendan Patterson
fields.summary: running the uninstall only seems to remove icons

fields.description:
If the confluence home directory is stored inside the install directory, it will be rather disastrous if the user pointed the new Confluence installation to data folder in the old directory and then deleted the old install directory later down the track. We were thinking it might be more future proof to store the data directory outside of the Confluence 2.2.1 directory e.g. C:\PROGRAM FILES\ATLASSIAN\CONFLUENCE DATA\ .
- Ernest

assign to: Brendan Patterson
fields.summary: move data dir. to a safer location than inside the install dir

fields.description:
We were also thinking of making the 'Confluence 2.2.1' link in the Start menu an HTML link that will launch the default browser and points to localhost:<whatever port number we decide on> (instead of the current link where it will force the user to use IE).  - Ernest

assign to: Brendan Patterson
fields.summary: launch default browser instead of IE

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-6553].
  {panel}

If Confluence is installed as a service, we can then have the following icons in the Start menu:

> Confluence 2.2.1
> Start Service
> Stop Service
> Uninstall Confluence 2.2.1   
- Ernest 

assign to: Brendan Patterson
fields.summary: Start Menu - program group list

fields.description:
To avoid potential port conflicts with other Tomcat installations (and JIRA), we should set the default port (connection and shut down) to another value besides 8080/8005. I am not sure what the most random port number is but obviously we are just looking to avoid clashes. - Ernest

assign to: Brendan Patterson
fields.summary: we should avoid conflicting with ports already being used - especially if we run as service
install Confluence as a service on Windows
will the installer prompt to install the JDK?
installer still not setting JAVA_HOME env. variable

fields.description:
I am not sure why there are two versions (with and without JRE). Ideally we'd prefer to have a single version that works for all types of users. Is this possible?  - Ernest

assign to: brendan
fields.summary: should there be two versions or one version of the installer (with and without JRE)?
Add user filter to contentbylabel macro

fields.description:
The image resolution for a PDF and for a web site are necessarily different but Confluence uses the same image for both.

Right now I've got one resolution for the web but I'd like a much higher resolution image for the PDF. 

One solution could be adding a size tag to images on the wiki input, e.g.
!image.png|align=center|size=550px! 
and then attaching a high res picture with confluence downsampling for display

A second solution coulde be to attach two images to a page and have confluence know how to do the right thing.

A third solution would be to have confluence support svg. :-)

cheers,
adrian
fields.summary: Images exported into a PDF file are not in a high resolution

fields.description:
When I start up tomcat, if Confluence is also starting, and my DISPLAY environment variable is set to anything (including valid ones), Tomcat fails to start with this command line output:

Using CATALINA_BASE:   /usr0/jakarta-tomcat-5.0.28
Using CATALINA_HOME:   /usr0/jakarta-tomcat-5.0.28
Using CATALINA_TMPDIR: /usr0/jakarta-tomcat-5.0.28/temp
Using JAVA_HOME:       /usr0/jdk1.5.0_05
--some time passes here while tomcat starts --
X11 connection rejected because of wrong authentication.

The catalina.out log gives more insight --heres' the info printed at the end of the log file, when confluence is starting (the last application to try to start before tomcat crashes):

INFO: Installing web application at context path /confluence from URL file:/usr0/jakarta-tomcat-4.1.29/webapps/confluence
2006-07-07 17:04:44,271 INFO [com.atlassian.confluence.lifecycle] contextInitialized Starting Confluence 2.2.5 (build #520)

Initializing c3p0 pool... com.mchange.v2.c3p0.PoolBackedDataSource@1d0e17a [ connectionPoolDataSource -> com.mchange.v2.c3p0.WrapperConnectionPoolDataSource@1a0283e [ acquireIncrement -> 1, acquireRetryAttempts -> 30, acquireRetryDelay -> 1000, autoCommitOnClose -> false, automaticTestTable -> null, breakAfterAcquireFailure -> false, checkoutTimeout -> 0, connectionTesterClassName -> com.mchange.v2.c3p0.impl.DefaultConnectionTester, factoryClassLocation -> null, forceIgnoreUnresolvedTransactions -> false, idleConnectionTestPeriod -> 100, initialPoolSize -> 0, maxIdleTime -> 30, maxPoolSize -> 15, maxStatements -> 0, maxStatementsPerConnection -> 0, minPoolSize -> 0, nestedDataSource -> com.mchange.v2.c3p0.DriverManagerDataSource@6f3ea [ description -> null, driverClass -> null, factoryClassLocation -> null, jdbcUrl -> jdbc:hsqldb:/usr0/jakarta-tomcat-4.1.29/webapps/confluence/WEB-INF/data/database/confluencedb, properties -> {user=******, password=******} ] , preferredTestQuery -> null, propertyCycle -> 300, testConnectionOnCheckin -> false, testConnectionOnCheckout -> false, usesTraditionalReflectiveProxies -> false ] , factoryClassLocation -> null, numHelperThreads -> 3, poolOwnerIdentityToken -> 1d0e17a ]

fields.summary: Ability to run two different spaces on different domains

fields.description:
When recovering pages, there is no easy way to find out the deletion date and username of the deletor in the Space Admin -> Trash view. When finding a dead link caused by a page being deleted, no information is available in Trash to indicate who deleted the page and when, where any useful content was moved to, or why the page was deleted. 

Just showing the username and deletion date may be enough, but it would be useful if when deleting a page, fields were made available to provide a optional redirect link and reason for deletion. This information can be used when deciding to purge pages from Trash or deciding if they should be recovered.
fields.summary: More information about deleted pages in Trash view eg username, delete date and reason

fields.description: I'm working on the testplan plugin, and noticed that an extra image was showing up on the PDF page. After digging, I realized it was the image I used to get the testplan able to jump to the last click step; essentially, at the end of the plan, I've set an img tag in the velocity template defined as: checkAnchors looks at the URL to figure out if the user clicked a step, and sets the location of the window to that step so its not scrolled to the top on a long plan. In web browsers, the image is invisible, but the PDFs that are generated have the image show up at the end of the plan.
fields.summary: Images with explicit height and width of 0 are showing up in PDF exports

fields.description:
I had a wiki page with some pre-formatted text (a text visualization of a tree of things).  The first line had a bunch of leading space followed by the text for the root of the tree.  Anytime I edited that page, the leading space would be removed (even though I didn't edit that line).  I'd have to always remember to go to the wiki markup and insert the leading spaces again.  The following lines also had leading spaces, but those were preserved as expected.

I've heard from colleagues that this is not limited to pre-formatted text; it happens with the first line after many other confluence tags as well.  I haven't verified this, but it's probably true.
fields.summary: Rich text editor loses leading spaces in first line after 'noformat' tag.
CamelCase should be a space-level option

fields.description: I'm editing a wiki page that's a few screenfuls long.  I hit backspace to remove a blank line a near the bottom of the document.  The scrollable edit window scrolls to the top.

Improve Confluence label search syntax

fields.description: I have about 200 groups from LDAP and 35 local groups. When I first go to Manage Groups screen, I see a list of 10 groups appearing in some random order (NOT alphabetical) and an continuation of pages 1-10 and next button. First issue - please show MORE than 10 on a page. I would like 25 or more! Anyway, if I click on the 10th one then click NEXT, I get an new list of possible pages from 1-20 and next button. Now things seem to be orderer alphabetically including items on the page that use to be in the earlier pages! I can't go back and click on pages 1-10 cause then it goes back to previous behavior (only showing 1-10 and NOT in alphabetically order). Click on page 20 and magically 4 more pages are possible - from 1-24 and next button. Looks alphabetical. Then I click on page 21 and now its starting to show me my Confluence defined groups in alphabetical order EXCEPT for confluence-user and confluence-administrators which show on the LAST page at the end. There is no subsetting or searching on this screen, so it is very unmanagable.
fields.summary: Manage Groups behavior with LDAP

fields.description:
A customer has requested the ability to archive page versions which are more than, say 20, versions old. Purely to conserve storage space.

A custom setting would be ideal, in which you could specify the number of page versions to show and then archive the rest.
fields.summary: Archive older versions of a page's history

fields.description:
A customer has requested the ability to globally edit existing label names.

This is not to be confused with the current level of 'editing' which allows you to add or remove a page's labels. Editing a label on a page level right now would simply assign a new label to that page, and wouldn't effect the labels on any other pages.

The customer wants a seperate administrative label function which allows users/administrators to globally edit existing labels used in Confluence. Any edits made at this level would update the label across the entire system.
fields.summary: Add global label edit function to edit existing label names
Add Jforum integration
search macro display search refining box option
Seaching of zipped attachments

fields.description:
I move a heierarchically related set of pages by editing the top page and all its children and typing in the name of the destination space and the new owning page.

When I move the pages, all the anchored headings are referenced with space key of the previous space. This is very annoying since I may have to move 500 pages!
fields.summary: When I move pages to another space, anchor references are labeled with the space key of the former space

fields.description:
Hi,

When editing a list of bullet points within a table cell we are getting a problem on the save. The text can be entered correctly using the WYSIWYG editor and the preview pane looks fine - however when you save the page the a random bullet in the list gets converted into *.

I have attached a wiki markup textfile of a page which shows the problem - edit the first line to be a bullet point, then save and see it change.

Regards,

pj.
fields.summary: WYSIWYG Editor problem when editing bulleted list within a table cell
gfgfg

fields.description:
Comments attached to pages that inherit restrictions from parent pages seem to ignore the inherited permissions in the Confluence index.

Steps to reproduce:

1) Enable anonymous Confluence access
2) Create a space with anonymous access
3) Add a page and restrict view to confluence-users
4) Add a subpage 
5) Add a comment to this subpage

The comment will appear in the dashboard recently updated list even for anonymous users. Trying to access it however will result in a credentials check. 

The comment will also appear in any public RSS feed which only has "comment" in its type list. Curiously they won't appear if the feed is configured to filter other content types such as pages.

Adding a comment directly to the parent page which has the restriction set does not trigger this behaviour.
fields.summary: Comment index entries do not inherit permissions correctly
Add Summary to RSS feeds generated by Confluence

fields.description:
The cache stats page is confusing right now.

A few easy wins:
- give caches real names
- reduce the length of the display
- only display caches which contain entries in the simple view
- remove distributions (which just confuse people IMHO)
fields.summary: Improve and simplify cache statistics page

We are using Japanese Confluence purchased from Imahima Co. in Japan. 

Best regards,
Shoji

fields.description:
JTidy doesn't correctly parse balanced angle brackets inside XML comments (<!-- ... -->). Angle brackets should be allowed as literals in this case [1], but JTidy does not do this properly.

To replicate this, create a user macro with the following content:

<script>
<!--
if (4 < 5 && 3 > 2) alert("Oops.");
// -->
</script>

Include the user macro in a page, and export it to PDF. The part of the user macro following the greater-than sign is included in the PDF text.

The same bug exists for CDATA sections and browsers do not seem to understand correctly-escaped Javascript using > and <, at least in HTML 4.0 mode.

A workaround is to remove the greater-than sign (>) by using a negative condition.

if (4 < 5 && !(3 <= 2)) alert("Oops.");

This was identifed by a plugin author attempting to put commented Javascript in his Velocity template [2].

[1] http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-xml/#sec-comments
[2] http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257229977
fields.summary: PDF export breaks with angle brackets inside comments

fields.description:
This is a report, fyi, of a hang; not sure it is reproducible, but I have detailed logs from the event.

A user told me that she thought Confluence had crashed. I tried to access it via http, and received an error that the proxy was unable to respond to /GET.

I logged into the host and checked; the process was still running. So I collected the log files, then ran bin/shutdown.sh and bin/startup.sh. Confluence is running ok. Below is email from the user, describing her actions (which you can also reconstruct from the access log, attached).

The user's complaint that Confluence's clock is off by an hour is a daylight savings time issue.

Thanks,

Cheryl

----------------------  user email about hang -----------------------


	From: 	  rmathias@4tginc.com
	Subject: 	Confluence Crash
	Date: 	June 28, 2006 12:21:23 PM PDT
	To: 	  cheryl@mathiastechnology.com

Thank you for fixing Confluence.

I was editing this page in rich text mode using Firefox:
http://confluence.mathiasconsulting.com/display/mkt/MMIS+Conference+Theme

I had already successfully inserted CooksIllustrated0001.jpg in the page. I wanted to put another graphic next to it. I clicked on the insert graphic icon. The 4 graphics attached to the page were displayed. I selected CooksIllustrated0002.jpg and clicked Thumbnail. I believe that I got as far as clicking on the insert button. After that, there was a long pause. I thought that it might take a while to insert the graphic, so I switched to a different screen while I was waiting (using Desktop Manager).

On the new screen, I saw that there was a Firefox page open where I had been looking at a PDF a few days ago but no longer had security access for that page (this was a secure page which had timed out). I clicked the red button to close that window. Firefox crashed. When I tried to restart Firefox and reload the session, Firefox crashed again.

I rebooted my computer.

After reboot, I opened Firefox again, this time without restoring the last session. At that point, I realized that Confluence had crashed.

The page I had been editing (http://confluence.mathiasconsulting.com/display/mkt/MMIS+Conference+Theme) appears to be fine despite the crash. The graphic was not inserted. The Recent Changes list shows that the last change to the page was at 10:04.

The Confluence clock is one hour later than our clock, which is why I thought the crash was later.

Robin
--
Robin Mathias
Executive Consultant
FourThought Group, Inc.
Voice: 707-636-0418

http://4tginc.com

Want to know more about MITA? Visit http://4tginc.com/medicaid/mita/overview
fields.summary: confluence hangs

fields.description:
The Recently Updated section on the Dashboard exhibits buggy behavior with regard to users.

If a user has a personal space, but the logged in user does not have permissions to see it, the user will still appear in the "Recently Updated" list. 
The link points to the personal space. 
Clicking on the link will go to a page with a Permissions error. 
However, the date listed is in the past, and is (I suspect) the date the user last edited their profile.

It seems to me that ideally, if a viewer can not access a users personal space, the user should not be in the "Recently Updated" list at all.

I have seen http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-6158 but i think this issue is subtly different - in this case maybe its users who previously had a profile?
fields.summary: Can see other Users Profile/Personal Spaces hybrid in Recently Updated even if you dont have permissions to view them.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-6459].
  {panel}

Some ways the colour scheme UI could be improved:

1. Global colour scheme should be labelled as "global colour scheme" not "custom colour scheme".
2. Global colour scheme should not say "choose a colour scheme" when there isn't a choice
3. Global colour scheme should not use the label "selected" next to a colour scheme when there's no way to select any other.
4. Space colour scheme should be clearer in showing what is the default (global) colour scheme, and what is the custom. A colour scheme can either be customised or it can be default, but the UI implies there are more options.

It looks like the interface of both space and global colour scheme pages was designed for a situation where there are more than 2 options to choose from. For colour schemes, there is only default or custom. The interface should reflect this better.

Some other ideas:

1. Make it easy to reset a single colour back to either the global default or the saved value. Put two colour boxes on the right of the colour picker in columns labelled 'Global default' and 'Current value', where clicking on them changes the text box value.
2. Hide the unnecessary top row of colour boxes when editing a colour scheme.
fields.summary: Colour scheme UI is confusing

fields.description:
We discovered something pretty strange, it seems to have to do with international characters.

Suppose you have a page which contains a link to a yet non existing page called "üasdf1". You then follow the link in order to create the page. Works fine, no problems. 

Suppose you have a page which contains a link to a yet non existing page called "Üasdf2" (note the capitalized Umlaut). You then follow the link in order to create the page. After creating the page you navigate back to the parent page and you can see that the link to the new page is still a "add new page" link (with the tiny plus sign). See attachment "bug1.jpg" to see the parent page after these steps. The bug is also triggered by Ä and Ö, respectively.

Since the link to the page is still a "add new page" link, you can go ahead and create the same page over and over again. You end up with n pages called "Üasdf2". This is something that definitely shouldn't happen, n pages with the same name in the same space! See attachment "bug2.jpg".
fields.summary: New pages and capitalized Umlauts

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-6454].
  {panel}


See this table as example:

|| || Date || Time || 
|| Presenter | Some value | Another Value | 
|| Description | Foo | Bar | 

The headings at the top of the table (Date & Time) are centered, and looks good (even although in some cases one would prefer left alignment for status messages or right for numbers).

However, the heading on the left (Presenter & Description) are also center aligned, and this does NOT look good. Recommendation for a very simple solution would be that these headings used as row headers are all just left aligned. That should already be sufficient.

The delux fix (but really not required not) would have additional syntax with which alignment can be specified for all headings.
fields.summary: Alignment of Table Headers when used as Row Headings

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-6453].
  {panel}

Confluence should allow uses to create and save "smart lists": a list of Confluence content retrieved by applying a configurable set of search criteria.

For example, a smart list might be created with the following search criteria:
* content type: page
* label: documentation
* spaces: favourite spaces
* created by: Charles Miller

This list of content should be able to be saved as a "smart list" then shown on the dashboard, subscribed to as RSS, notified of changes via email, etc.

The search criteria should be extensible through plugins, so custom criteria for plugins such as the metadata plugin can be defined.

This functionality is similar to JIRA's filters, but we can probably improve the UI in some ways.
fields.summary: Smart lists (persistent search filters)
